column3:
01:07 GMT
Lamont could hear the sound of a car coming from behind him. Moments later a green Jaguar drove past and proceeded along the driveway, lights full on. It came to a halt outside the house.

But the most striking difference was the time of day. Outside the basement windows, night had fallen. The streetlights were on and there was a full moon out.
“Whoa,” I heard myself whisper. I glanced at the digital alarm clock sitting on top of one of the bookshelves. Its glowing blue display said the local time was now 1:07 A.M.
